title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I don't know much about but if you could answer with honesty and detail. It will be very helping you to be successful with the interviewer. and also you need to explain your experience with your prior work and relationship with co-workers.
Interview Questions: It was like what is the reason you are in this school?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview on Zoom. I was asked about why I wanted to work part of the university, any previous experiences I had, availability. It was well organized and I was updated well of the process.
Interview Questions: Q: What previous experiences do you have related to this role?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: It was a good professional interview that I had . just to take a long time to get back to you. But overall it was A very good experience to have
Interview Questions: How did you manage if a supervisor it’s not there

title: Graduate Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Discuss your resume and qualifications, familiarity with the subject you will teach (mostly labs), and your comfort level speaking in front of classrooms/students. Also discussion on the expectations for your responsibilities (essentially you are the only instructor for the class)
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you speaking in front of students (typical range is 20-50 students)

title: Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel interview and extensive background check, psychology testing, and lie detector test after you pass the initial interview. All the interviewers were of different ages and ranks in the company.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience?

title: Undergraduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Short interview with the research lead asked questions about my motivation for his research project and my experience in the technology that his team worked with. I wasn't technical at all and I think they were just seeing if I had interest in the project.
Interview Questions: What is your skills in web development.

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview similar to all other intro/starting jobs. Do expect to be underpaid and paid once a month similar to all other government jobs. I would not work there again, take your experience and run
Interview Questions:
what is a weakness you have?
-ans how did you overcome it

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience and the interviewer was very nice and understanding. I was nervous going into it but she made it an enjoyable interview as I was able to get to a little bit about her and she was able to get to know a little bit about me.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Supprot Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy. I followed up once after I didn't hear back, they said they would have an answer by the end of the week. Two more weeks went by and I wanted to move on so I followed up one last time, just to hear "the position has been filled." They had no plans of letting me know unless I asked I guess.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe your commitment to Diversity Equity and Inclusion

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
There's only one round of interview. There were three interviewers and three interviewees in the room. We took turns answering the questions printed on the paper given to us at the start of the interview. 
It was a group interview and make sure you do not use the same ideas as the person answering the question before you. 
It took approximately half an hour
Interview Questions: How do you balance work and study?

title: Administrator Coordinator 1 Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Interview in person for 30 minutes. 4 People took my interview. All of them work for CSUF. Administrator Coordinator of another department, Department chair, 2 other employees who previously worked in the same profile.  Total 12 questions were asked. Each questions had 2-3 parts. Therefore, write down questions and ask if I answered your question after finishing your response.  3 questions each member asked. At the end Candidate was given chance to ask questions.


You can ask -

What are your expectations from the candidate you want to hire? 

Please explain what are the key responsibilities for this role?

If I am successful today at interview. What is the first thing you would need me to concentrate on in this Administration Coordinator role?
Interview Questions:
Describe your current job responsibilities and why did you applied for this position?

Tell about your educational background.

Work experience under diversity work culture.

How would you handle students who are very aggressive or angry 😡?

How  you will put your opinion if all the team members have different opinions if there is a issue you are dealing with?

How would  you rate yourself in using softwares or technical skills?

How  is your accuracy if you work on large amount of data?

How do you manage your work load and priorities? 

What are your strengths?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was super quick and easy, it was over zoom and thirty min after the zoom interview they called me and said I got the position. Don't know what else to say except it was pretty easy, they asked standard questions
Interview Questions: tell me about a time when you got overwhelmed

title: Academic Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Excellent process. Very professional. The recruitment was thoughtful and helped demonstrate their interest and commitment in candidates. Very well orchestrated process on campus and during the lead up to f2f meetings.
Interview Questions: Why I was a fit for the position.

title: Student Services Professional III Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was two parts, a small one on one  interview with another SSP III, so would have been a peer. Second part was responding to hypothetical student emails on the computer. 

The second interview was (3) rounds which totally through me off guard. First round was a panel of 10 questions with (4) other SSP III’s. Second round, I had to present a 10min presentation. Third round, another panel but with (13) people. Basically the entire office I was applying for. I would say it was an extremely intense process.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with people with disabilities?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Director and supervisor interviewed and asked questions regarding research experiences, skills, etc. Friendly staff and coworkers. Diverse culture. Highly recommend to students who love research and want to gain research experience in higher education settings
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Helpdesk- Student Genius Center Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted as a group interview. Standard S.T.A.R. questions. Strengths and weaknesses, tell us about yourself, how would you describe yourself, why are you interested in this position, etc.
Interview Questions: What is one of your greatest weaknesses?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: it was about a 30 minute interview process. i’d say that the questions were fair and easy to answer. after the interview, i did a background check and was then offered the position.
Interview Questions: a lot of scenario based questions

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: There was first a phone interview with the search committee on Zoom with the cameras off. Then candidates who advanced were asked to do a virtual "on campus" interview that involved a research talk. They were clear about timeline and next steps.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this position at Cal State Fullerton?

title: Site Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. One with the Program Coordinator, and one with the Program Director. Both interviews are 30-45min long. Really easy going people. Be prepared to take a written test about drafting a short activity for the students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via Zoom. It was an initial interview and lasted 20 minutes and the committee asked about 5 questions. Felt very rushed. Didn't hear back for several months when they initially said they would let me know in a few weeks if I made it to the next round of interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your work experience?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Orange, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple and easy. They asked you questions not just to learn about you academically but as a person and were genuinely interested in your life.
Interview Questions: Tell us more about yourself?

title: Digital Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very friendly and welcoming. They did not try to speak down or try to act well above your position. Very prompt and concise questions relating to the task at hand.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to commit myself to this school?

title: Instructional Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It went smooth, no that bad. The interviewer asked all the fundamental questions about the circuits, amplifiers, filters, types of filters, and how do they function because I applied for a Grader position.
Interview Questions: What is an amplifier, types of amplifiers?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: 6 people interviewed me at once, which was intimidating to a certain extent, but it all worked out. I also has to write a quite page on a prompt that gave me to do after the interview was over.
Interview Questions: Do you like to work alone or in a team?

title: Business Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel of four interviewees including amateur level positions to sit in for the interview in management position. Lots of questions asked and lots of answers written down. 30 minutes-1 hour long.
Interview Questions: Tell us your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received the phone interview request after applying 2 months. Many professors (over 15, I guess) attended the phone interview and each asked one or two questions. It took about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about your research topics. 
- Why do you want to work at our school? 
- What is your teaching philosophy?
...

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. There were 3 other interviewees together with me. There were 3 interviewers (both are my current supervisors and 1 senior SI). They would ask the questions from the lists and we interviewees will take turns answering.
Interview Questions: They asked questions regarding what is SI, why you apply, what's the difference between SI and tutoring

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straightforward, and since I was referred for this particular position by an employee of the company - i felt more comfortable.  I would definitely interview again in the future assuming that i could afford to take the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the professor about my interest in working with him. The next step is meeting with the professor to discuss your past experience. The professor will ask you a bunch of questions and I replied to those questions.
Interview Questions: What would you like to do with this project

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Online apply, phone interviews, schedule a meeting, visiting the campus, meet with facutly, make a public presentation, answer the questions, waiting for the final answer, get a job offer, make a decision.
Interview Questions: academic experience

title: Student Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email from employer for an interview. Came into the office for an interview and spoke with the employer for an hour about the position and the future of where the position will  be
Interview Questions: What are your experiences that can be applied to this position?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Students needed to have a 90% in intermediate research methods class or higher to be considered for the position. Professor would email us with instructions on how we would describe what we would bring to the table as a University Teaching Assistant.
Interview Questions: What makes you feel that you are suitable for the position?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The culture of interviews if pretty standard. You usually get a panel of different staff and managers.  They ask questions on qualitative and quantitative skills. The process can be long and one always has to complete a set of tasks before the panel reaches a final answer.
Interview Questions: What would your former supervisor say about you?

title: Arts Week Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for this position was pretty simple. I applied for the position middle of September, and I interviewed at the end of September. I was interviewed by the Graduate Assistant/Co-Advisor of the Arts Inter-Club Council, along with the 3 student leaders of AICC. They asked me a series of questions, and the setting was really calm. I heard back about a week or so later that I had gotten the position.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and weaknesses

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, they really care and want you to be the best you can be. If you are a student they are diligent to work with your schedule -- worked under DIRC specifically and I am so grateful to have had the opportunity.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenge and how you overcame it.

title: Telephone Interviewer/Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after about two days they offered me an interview in person. The interview was fairly easy and there was not a lot of questions they asked. They made us read a script and asked some basic questions about our selves
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The search committee go through the initial screening of applications and narrows down the list to around 10. They have phone interviews with the 10 candiates, asking simple question to learn more about the candidates. The search committee reduces the list to around 4 candidates, and invite them to for formal interviews.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at CSU Fullerton?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and fast. they just want to get to know you and your personality.  The supervisor was the one that interviewed me. He was very friendly.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very good job interview. it was very soothing. They ask me to relax, calm and not to be impatient. They were very good and nice with me.
Interview Questions: How are you? Have you done this job before? What is  your residential address? Why you want to do this job? Do you know C, C#?

title: Student Grader & Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I e-mailed all the professors in CSUF about being a Grader and then Professor Emailed to meet him in his office and offered me to assist him in his Project and  Grade for two undergraduate classes. 
I was excited and
Interview Questions: On What basis should i trust you for this work?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is about 2+ months start to finish. While the process is long, someone is always willing to assist in communication or to answer questions. Those interviewing were pleasant to speak with and were willing to answer questions when asked,
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in the workplace vs. out of the workplace.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Easy questions, not much pressure.
Talk about what you posted on your resume, still with the script prepared for the interview, basic STAR questions related to the job, and previous experiences. The interview process would last for long, depending on the level of the job role.
Interview Questions: Related past experience, situational questions, STAR approach is advised to clear it smoothly

title: Instructional Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: the interview was with the professor who i wanted to work under and i was well prepared for the basic engineering questions anyone would ask. it lasted about 20 mins and all he wanted to know were my goals and abilities in life.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Email and phone call to setup face to face interview.  They were willing to work with my schedule to setup a convenient time for the face to face interview. In person interview with supervisor of the department was straightforward. Ask about my school schedule , how well did I know Excel and somethings about my past work experiences.
Interview Questions: How was your schedule?

title: Student Assistant - Department of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty straight forward with basic behavioral questions and few job related questions. The interview was conducted by 2 people and focus was more on knowledge based on excel.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Administrative Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a phone interview, followed by two on-campus panel committee interviews, multiple one-on-one interviews, and an additional writing assessment. The overall hiring process took approximately four weeks, conditional on a passed background check and multiple reference checks.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Cal State Fullerton?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: contact to professor, send copy of resume. Include all previous experience, project work, and courses taken. emphasis on topics which are related to position. Include some projects which are related to position
Interview Questions: back ground question from resume

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Simple, fairly straightforward interview process. Asked a lot of personality questions, and a little of technical. Overall, it was a group interview and took about a couple of weeks to get an answer. Hours were a bit odd so that is why I didn't take the offer. Nice staff and people. Looked like a good place to work but did not fit my schedule at all.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses in a team-oriented setting?

title: Evaluation Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with three staff members -- all courteous and professional. They went around the table asking questions and wrote down my answers/notes. The whole process took less than an hour. I appreciated their warmth -- the director was welcoming and it seemed like she made an effort to not come off as intimidating. Overall, it was a great interview experience. I would have happily taken the job if they weren't on such a tight budget, which affected my salary offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself. Why are you leaving your previous job? Tell us about your strengths and weaknesses. Tell us about some of the projects you worked on at your previous job. What were some difficult situations that you experienced at work and how did you deal with them? What is something you feel proud of accomplishing at your previous job?

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set up by the director, and I was then interviewed by her. She then gave me a tour of the office! She was very kind and the interview was very conversational. The process took 2 weeks. I got accepted.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Social Media? What is a specific campaign you have seen that you liked and why?

title: Analyst Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was done by a panel, and it was very confusing over the phone who was asking which question. The questions were mostly personality type. The in person interview was also done by a panel, and it included technical and personality questions. There were three interviewers. Interviewers were knowledgeable about the job that I interviewed for. The technical questions were very relevant to the job, and included PeopleSoft and SQL. However, the personality questions were standard HR personality questions that didn't mean anything.
Interview Questions: What is an inner join?

title: Web Master Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a one on one interview. I had to show my portfolio on web development and had to explain my projects of Wordpress PhP. They also asked for some of the graphic design work. The interview  was very relaxed. the interviewer gave me enough time to explain my portfolio and asked to the point questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was very casual and straightforward. This position is only available to current students and will typically receive an interview from the faculty liaison. It was relatively easy and just measures how confident you are in the content that you will be instructing, as well as your handling of certain situations that may arise while working.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you when speaking with foreign students? What would you say is the most difficult task students face when going through classes x, y, z?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: A friend referred me. I have applied to all the positions online. And I have received an email from the recruiter and then I was called for interview. Interview was smooth and friendly. Basic question were asked. referral works mostly. Once we get a call, chances are more that we get the job.
Interview Questions: The questions were like How do you raise a ticket? Tell me a hard problem that you have recently solved.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process might have been a bit harsher, but I knew the professor in question.  Not much of an interview was needed considering he was familiar with my work.  The Math Department then had to just confirm and stamp everything and I was able to begin working.  I would say attention to detail and the ability to provide feedback would be the necessary traits which the interviewer would be looking.
Interview Questions: How to parametrize the intersection of a plane and cylinder in 3-space.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received an e-mail for an on-site interview. I scheduled the interview for next week. They invited me for an on-campus interview. It was fairly easy. The duration was 20-30 minutes. I got hired on the spot. I was interviewed by the Director and Finance Analyst.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: easy interview. only academic questions were asked. just had a one on one interview with my advisor. he described the job function and my duties, start date and the compensation rate.
Interview Questions: academic questions

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was roughly a 45-minute interview with at least three people facilitating questions that engage biographical details and then shifted to relevance and contribution to the workplace. The department has each ethnic respective center and its own needs so knowing the community's issues and the background is crucial when applying. (e.g. Chicana/o, Asian American Resource Center, etc)
Interview Questions: What is one social justice issue that is currently going on in the world and what are your thoughts on it?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Actually this was the hardest interview I have ever been through. I was asked multiple questions within one question and was given quite a few, long, situational questions where I had to determine the best way to handle the situation. Also went out for lunch with my supervisor and another future colleague, which was pleasant but I still had to stay on my game.
Interview Questions: Requests for career services has increased but attendance at workshops has gone down. How do you address this?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were two people who interviewed me and the process was very simple. Answer a series of questions they had on their list. The questions were mainly about my availability and basic questions one would expect to be asked when interviewing for an office job.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Mihaylo College of Business and Economics Touring Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Briefly introduce the personal ideas regarding how to be a tutors, how to deal with the relationship with sutdents. Providing some recommendations to students based on experience. Given some cases to analyze how to teach, such as facing with different type of students how to solve questions and how to explian  .
Interview Questions: Can you give some idea recommendations to student based on your experience ?

title: Interviewee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was exceptionally fast, which can be somewhat unusual in this field. I was invited to first interview by Skype for an initial conversation that lasted approximately 30 minutes. I was asked six questions that were designed to address my suitability and interest in the position as well as allow the committee to get to know me and for me to understand what they are hoping to find in the ideal candidate. I was later asked to interview for the second round, an intensive half-day long interview that included a presentation to the department. While this was challenging, the experience was smooth and I felt I grew from the interview experience already.
Interview Questions: If offered the position, what would you do in the first 60 days and in the first 90 days on the job?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went through two rounds. One is behavioral and the other one is technical.First I had to meet with the program's coordinator and then with the assistant coordinator. I had to keep following them to know my interview results since they seemed so busy. I heard from them after 2 months.
Interview Questions: How would I manage an arrogant coworker?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I Applied online through Titan Connections. The next day I received a call asking for my availability in order to schedule an interview the following week. I was interviewed by two staff members for about 40 minutes and was told I would hear back from them within a week. Two days later I received a call with a job offer. It is overall a quick and easy process.
Interview Questions:
Typical interview questions like:
What are some of your hobbies, Why do you want to work here, etc.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online on website. Got a call in a week to setup a 1:1 interview. Basic web development questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Do you any experience in C# and MqSql

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: Simple. I got a call and next thing was the interview. Interview questions are generally easy to answer assuming that you are related to the particular subject.
Interview Questions: No unexpected question. The subject field is fairly new to industry.

title: Technical Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton
Interview Descriptions: easy just hr interview and 1 easy technical interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Skyped and interviewed by committee, the connection dropped in the middle of the process. It went OK but I only lived 350 miles away so a live meeting could have been done easily. Still, I got the job so it worked out.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Human Resources Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a panel interview over the phone and another, in person panel interview. The people on the panel were pleasant and the interview in person took about 45 minutes. I was told that a decision would be made within 2 days as to whom they would proceed with and that I would be contacted by the end of that week with their decision. Many weeks have now passed and I can presume that I was not selected to continue. Having worked in human resources for many years and held numerous phone and in person interviews, I make sure to contact all candidates I have spoken to, either by email or phone so they are not left hanging. I would have expected this from a large university like CSUF but their lack of follow up has left me feeling as if I am fortunate to have not been chosen.
Interview Questions: None were that difficult or unexpected. Most of the questions had to do with scenarios that I had dealt with in the past and were experiences that I had actually had. A panel interview can be difficult for some but I found that these interviewers were non threatening and they asked questions that were expected for this type of position.

title: Mathematics Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place in a classroom and you are given a question bank consisting of math problems in different subjects (e.g. logarithms, polynomials, etc.) You are then taken to a room where you are given ~20 minutes to formulate a "lecture" where you solve a problem (or more) from the problem bank. The panel, consisting of current professors typically of the education department, will ask you questions along the way.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to teach someone a subject that they were not comfortable in.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took awhile for a call back. I applied in Feb/March and did not receive a call back until June. I was interviewed by a few people - who I never met again - but it was pretty easy, they did not ask difficult questions and were super friendly.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths?

title: Graduate Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: You apply, if you have experience teaching, or if they just need teachers you should be good. They like students who want to teach in the future. There is not much of an interview beyond your statement of purpose.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach?

title: Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had no interview. I applied with my resume while out of state. I was about to attend school there and decided to look for work opportunities. I was hired on based off my resume with no interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: You must submit a written application with a writing sample and recommendations to the English department in the spring. Those eligible are invited to interview in person. Interviews included one to two applicants at a time with a panel of three to four people, including current tutors, supervisors, and possibly professors. It lasts about 15-20 minutes in person and an additional couple of weeks to hear back on final decisions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation in which you tutor someone who is writing about a controversial or offensive topic that you disagree with?

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was straightforward. The interview started with a review of my application and transcripts then went toward a Q&A session They asked me questions and I answered, then I asked questions and they answered.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in teaching?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submit application, get called back a few weeks later, interview with director was both technical and standard questions you get in every job interview, received job offer day of interview, start training soon after
Interview Questions: what is your strength?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was kinda informal. they don't expect you to have any experience to hire you as a student assistant at IT Department in CSUF. You just need to be referred by someone or be lucky to apply when there is vacant job position as student assistant available.
Interview Questions: No unexpected or difficult question. they just want to make sure that you are passionate to learn and you are an intelligent person

title: Front Desk Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Single person being asked questions by two office employees (the direct supervisor of the position and the supervisor's closest co-worker). It took less than an hour to complete the interview and about 3 days to hear back with their decision.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application because I heard they were hiring tutors for the next semester. A month later received a call saying they wanted to set up an interview. The interview was very easy going. Asked a background of my studies, and tutoring experiences. A few questions on how I would react in different scenarios.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clerical Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Selected a few outside hires while most candidates are inside. Each candidate is interviewed in front of the hiring manager and the corresponding clerical worker (whos position you will be replacing). Questions are basic, nothing too out of the ordinary. I had interviewed as a clerical worker multiple times, and it seems they always hire from within.
Interview Questions: Whats your schedule like?

title: Hardware Verification Engineer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was long but there were very basic questions regarding skills.
Interview Questions: what is VHDL, Verilog?

title: Assistant to the Dean At CSU Irvine Campus Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Irvine, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: First there was a panel interview, followed a few weeks later by a skills assessment test.  It took a few weeks for them to make a decision, and I was notified by email that I was not selected for the job.  They did a good job of showing me around the campus following the in-person interview - nice touch.  I had some contact with the HR department in between interviews, so I really thought I had a shot.  The location of the campus was somewhat scary, located in the former El Toro base in the Great Park.  However, they are moving in a few months nearby the Irvine Spectrum.  That made a big difference for me, or else I would not have taken the job.  The people were nice, but the work culture seems a little quiet for me, coming from a much larger organization.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation when a sensitive or difficult issue came up on the job, and how you handled it with the client, as well as your immediate co-workers.

title: GA In Business School Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: got a phone call from the secrect. on site interview. took about 20 min. ask basic questions about resume.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Fullerton (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was a very simple interview process that consisted of questions about my work background, and how I react to negative situations.  This was my first job, and I'd guess the interview process would be similar to getting a job in any other kind of office setting. Really nice people that didn't make me nervous at all.
Interview Questions: How do you respond to an irate individual?
